players.name: Alice
memory: You're Alice, the villager.
Night 1 begins.
Diana was found dead.
Day 1 begins.
Charlie: "This is terrible! Diana was killed on the first night. We need to work together to find the mafioso among us three."
Bob: "Charlie is the mafioso. I’m the detective and I have proof. We should vote to arrest Charlie now to keep the town safe."
You: "Bob, if you are truly the detective, why don’t you share the proof you mentioned? Accusing Charlie without evidence could be risky for the town."

Bob: "Charlie has been acting suspiciously since the start, and I investigated him last night—he's the mafioso. Alice, I understand your caution, but we can't afford to hesitate. Arresting him now is our best chance."
You: "Bob, if you really investigated Charlie and found him guilty, show us your proof now. Otherwise, accusing without evidence might lead us astray and help the mafioso."

Charlie: "Bob, you claim to be detective but your story doesn't add up. A real detective would know they can't 'show proof' - investigations are private knowledge only. Alice is right to be skeptical of your baseless accusation."
Votes: Alice voted for Bob, Bob voted for Charlie, Charlie voted for Bob
Bob was arrested
